heading:
Reading : Celtic Cross

The Celtic Cross is an old and traditional reading; in nearly every tarot description it is found, with usually slightly different interpretations.

The Celtic Cross responds to a question that the reader has, subconciously or conciously. They often address the deepest cause and elements of a situation facing the reader.

cards.readingSpotExplanation: Card 1 and 2 describe the question or problem facing the reader, either indicating 2 sides of an issue, or very clearly indicating one thing with 2 similar or related cards.
Card 1 and 2 describe the question or problem facing the reader, either indicating 2 sides of an issue, or very clearly indicating one thing with 2 similar or related cards.
Card 3 describes what you want, and how you want it.
Card 4 describes what you are thinking and which questions you're asking yourself.
Card 5 describes the circumstances of your recent past.
Card 6 describes de circumstances of your near future.
Card 7 describes what your fears are.
Card 8 describes what the influence of your environment is concerning the issue indicated by cards 1 and 2. It may indicate whether or not people are willing to help you.
Card 9 describes what you are hoping for, what your desires are.
Card 10 is the advice card, indicating what you have to do to solve the issue described by cards 1 and 2.
